channel.title: Mopar is the best IRC question(Mirc)
channel.description: hay i tryed to join after some one made me get mIRC but the prob is i entered all the info from the sticky and then got my nick and then i typed /j #mopar and it let me go on but it seems to me that im always the only one on i see so many posts with quotes from 20+ people in the irs at one time but i don't have this i have no one what should i do?

@jme wrote:

Hmmm strange.

I see something about “N00B1W[][]T Erroneous Nickname”
Well before joining the server try /nick n00b1 – But no idea really. I thought you could use all those characters.

Well, might as well try this:
Do what I said last time, but instead of clicking on Local info, click on Identd.
There are my settings:
(Even though it says UNIX, I am running windows. These settings work fine for me.)

item.title: Mopar is the best IRC question(Mirc)
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

ill have a look [br][size=1]Posted on: April 01, 2007, 05:26:50 AM[/size][hr][quote=“jme_009, post:13, topic:72761”][quote author=MybJames link=topic=106945.msg1072537#msg1072537 date=1175404761]
you have an invalid username XD

At least thats what it says, change it to like bob or something -.-

[/quote]

It says hostname, not nickname.

Back on codestream I had this problem. If I connected using usa.codestream.org instead of irc.codestream.org it would work just fine.

Try using anthony.freenode.net instead.

Also, try going to tools>options> go under the ‘connect’ drop down and click on “local info.” Where it says “On connect, always get:” select Local host. Under “lookup method” select server.

Oh and btw it’s irc, not irs.[/quote]

done everything you said jme and i still get this

* Connect retry #8 208.71.169.36 (6667)
-
-208.71.169.36- *** Looking up your hostname...
-
-208.71.169.36- *** Checking ident
-
-208.71.169.36- *** Couldn't look up your hostname
-
-208.71.169.36- *** No identd (auth) response
-
Closing Link: 127.0.0.1 (Invalid username [n=makka.n0])
-
* Disconnected
-
* Connect cancelled
-
* Connecting to anthony.freenode.net (6667)
-
-anthony.freenode.net- *** Looking up your hostname...
-
-anthony.freenode.net- *** Checking ident
-
-anthony.freenode.net- *** Couldn't look up your hostname
-
<Mopar>N00B1W[][]T Erroneous Nickname
-
Closing Link: 127.0.0.1 (Invalid username [n=makka.n0])
-
* Disconnected
-
* Connect retry #1 208.71.169.36 (6667)
-
-208.71.169.36- *** Looking up your hostname...
-
-208.71.169.36- *** Checking ident
-
-208.71.169.36- *** Couldn't look up your hostname
-
* Disconnected

so what now?

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar is the best IRC question(Mirc)
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“MybJames, post:12, topic:72761”]you have an invalid username XD

At least thats what it says, change it to like bob or something -.-[/quote]

It says hostname, not nickname.

Back on codestream I had this problem. If I connected using usa.codestream.org instead of irc.codestream.org it would work just fine.

Try using anthony.freenode.net instead.

Also, try going to tools>options> go under the ‘connect’ drop down and click on “local info.” Where it says “On connect, always get:” select Local host. Under “lookup method” select server.

Oh and btw it’s irc, not irs.

Read full topic
item.source: Mopar is the best IRC question(Mirc)

item.title: Mopar is the best IRC question(Mirc)
item.dc:creator: @MybJames MybJames
item.description:
@MybJames wrote:

you have an invalid username XD

At least thats what it says, change it to like bob or something -.-

(IRC boys for life)

Oh, and for register, you should do

/msg nickserv register (password)

And the reason that nobody is in #mopar, is because you are connecting to the WRONG network
Mopar is on freenode not gamesurge.

Read full topic
